column4: Has anyone else experienced problems with nVidia 7-series proprietary drivers since they updated the driver?
- what problems are you having?
the system freezes.
- do you get error messages in your /var/log/kern.log? I get similar thing, albeit very rarely. I get cryptic errors in my logs.
not that I can see. What kind of errors do you get?
- cryptic :) - wait one i'll dig and error out the old logs

- did a google search on that ... turns out a lot of people have been experiencing this. System all of a sudden freezes, but mouse _may_ still work; or everything gets _really_ choppy on the graphics front, then the system freezes after. Nothing seems to help but a hard reboot
then I guess the best "solution" will be to do a clean install of gutsy and not install updates.. :(
- or not use NVidia's driver - switch to nv driver.... think there were some suggestions on the net ie workarounds. Check through your kern.logs first to see if your getting similar problems
yes, that might be a solution if only I could get a decent resolution. I've tried and tried again, but I cannot get higher resolution than 800x600.
- with the nv driver?
yes.
